result.execSummary:
The defendant Chak Gordon Lawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chak Gordon Lawson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chak Gordon Lawson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant to obtain the certificate of completion and copy to the District Attorney's Office and the Court and upon receipt will file a dismissal for Count 1.

Review hearing at 07-06-2016 03:30 pm

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Rebecca L., Ashley L., A.L.L., E.E.L., M.R.L., B. Lewis or V. Carlson and thier residence.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Chak Gordon Lawson appeared. Case called at 3:34 pm. Court reviews file. Parties have rec'd a copy of Compas. Atty Repka recites agreement. Recess. Case recalled at 3:50 pm. Atty Repka makes statement. ADA Correll responds.  Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count two, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count two. Parties make sentencing arguments. Court orders: 
-16 Days Jail. Credit for 16 Days
- Court Costs. Apply Bond. Remaing money on file to be returned to payor
- DNA Surcharge
- Domestic Abuse Assessment and Surcharge
If Defendant completes Assessment and follows recommendations court will dismiss count #1. Def to get certificate of completion to the DA's office and the court. The DA's office will then file a dismissal. km
  Review hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
